分一杯羹.definition: (fig.) to have a slice of the pie; to get a piece of the action

分久必合，合久必分.pinyin: fen1 jiu3 bi4 he2 , he2 jiu3 bi4 fen1
分久必合，合久必分.definition: lit. that which is long divided must unify, and that which is long unified must divide (idiom, from 三國演義|三国演义[San1 guo2 Yan3 yi4]); fig. things are constantly changing

分享.definition: to share (let others have some of sth good)

分佈.definition: to scatter; to distribute; to be distributed (over an area etc); (statistical, geographic) distribution

分佈式拒絕服務.pinyin: fen1 bu4 shi4 ju4 jue2 fu2 wu4
分佈式拒絕服務.definition: distributed denial of service (DDOS) form of Internet attack

分分鐘.definition: any minute now; in next to no time; at every minute; constantly

分列.definition: to divide into rows; to identify subcategories; to break down into constituent parts; breakdown; disaggregation

分別.definition: to part; to leave each other; to distinguish; to tell apart; difference; distinction; in different ways; differently; separately; individually

分割.definition: to cut up; to break up

分區.definition: allocated area (for housing, industry etc); district

分外.definition: exceptionally; not one's responsibility or job

分娩.definition: to give birth to a baby; (of animals) to give birth to young

分子.definition: Taiwan variant of 份子[fen4 zi5]

分宜.definition: see 分宜縣|分宜县[Fen1yi2 Xian4]

分宜縣.definition: Fenyi, a county in Xinyu 新余市[Xin1yu2 Shi4], Jiangxi

分家.definition: to separate and live apart; division of a large family into smaller groups

分寸.definition: propriety; appropriate behavior; proper speech or action; within the norms

分封.definition: to divide and confer (property on one's descendants)

分封制.definition: the feudal system; system of enfeoffment

分居.definition: to separate (married couple); to live apart (of husband and wife, family members)

分屏.definition: (computing) to split a screen into multiple sections to display different content simultaneously

分崩離析.definition: to collapse and fall apart (idiom); to break up; falling to pieces

分巡兵備道.definition: (Qing dynasty) provincial surveillance and defense commission

分工.definition: to divide up the work; division of labor

分庭抗禮.definition: peer competition; to function as rivals; to make claims as an equal

分心.definition: to divert one's attention; to get distracted; (courteous) to be so good as to take care of (a matter)

分憂.definition: to share tribulations; to help sb with worries and difficulties

分成.definition: to divide (into); to split a bonus; to break into; tenths; percentage allotment

分房.definition: to sleep in separate rooms; distribution of social housing

分手.definition: to part company; to split up; to break up

分手代理.definition: "break-up agent", person who acts for sb who wishes to terminate a relationship but does not have the heart to do so

分批.definition: to do sth in batches or groups

分拆.definition: to separate off; to hive off; a demerger

分擔.definition: to share (a burden, a cost, a responsibility)

分支.definition: branch (of company, river etc); to branch; to diverge; to ramify; to subdivide

分散.definition: to scatter; to disperse; to distribute

分數掛帥.definition: preoccupied with school grades; overemphasis on test scores

分數線.definition: horizontal line (in a fraction); minimum passing score

分文.definition: a single penny; a single cent

分曉.definition: the result (becomes apparent); now one understands

分期.definition: by stages; staggered; step by step; in installments

分期付款.definition: to pay in installments; payment in installments

分析處理.definition: to parse; analysis processing; to analyze and treat

分櫱.definition: tiller (stem at the base of grass plants)

分權制衡.definition: separation of powers for checks and balances

分步驟.definition: step by step; one step at a time

分歧.definition: divergent; difference (of opinion, position); disagreement; (math.) bifurcation

分段.definition: to divide (sth) into sections; to segment

分水嶺.definition: dividing range; drainage divide; (fig.) dividing line; watershed

分派.definition: to assign (a task to different people); to allocate

分流.definition: to diverge; to divert; to divide into separate streams (river flow, traffic etc); to stream (students into different programs); to reassign (redundant staff)

分清.definition: to distinguish (between different things); to make distinctions clear

分為.definition: to divide sth into (parts); to subdivide

分爭.definition: to dispute; to struggle for mastery

分班.definition: to divide people into groups, teams, squads etc

分發.definition: to distribute; distribution; to assign (sb) to a job

分社.definition: subdivision or branch of an organization; news bureau

分神.definition: to give some attention to; to divert one's attention; to be distracted

分秒必爭.definition: seize every minute and second (idiom); not a minute to lose; every moment counts

分租.definition: (of a landlord) to rent out one or more parts of a property; (of a tenant) to sublet one or more parts of a property; (agriculture) sharecropping

分竈吃飯.definition: "meals prepared at separate stoves", slogan of the program of fiscal decentralization that began in the 1980s in the PRC

分立.definition: to establish as separate entities; to divide (a company etc) into independent entities; discrete; separate; separation (of powers etc)

分管.definition: to be put in charge of; to be responsible for; branched passage

分級.definition: to rank; to grade; to classify; rank; grade; classification

分組.definition: to divide into groups; group (formed from a larger group); subgroup; (computer networking) packet

分肥.definition: to unfairly divide benefits, favoring a few

分至點.definition: common word for equinox and solstice; point of difference; point of divergence

分行.definition: branch of bank or store; subsidiary bank

分袂.definition: to leave each other; to part company

分裂.definition: to split up; to divide; to break up; fission; schism

分裂情感性障礙.pinyin: fen1 lie4 qing2 gan3 xing4 zhang4 ai4

分裝.definition: to divide into portions; to package in smaller quantities; to separate into loads

分解.definition: to resolve; to decompose; to break down

分解代謝.definition: catabolism (biology); metabolic breaking down and waste disposal; dissimilation

分設.definition: to set up separately; to establish separate units

分訴.definition: to narrate; to explain; to justify oneself

分贓.definition: to share the booty; to divide ill-gotten gains

分身.definition: (of one who has supernatural powers) to replicate oneself so as to appear in two or more places at the same time; a derivative version of sb (or sth) (e.g. avatar, proxy, clone, sockpuppet); to spare some time for a separate task; to cut a corpse into pieces; to pull a body apart by the four limbs; parturition

分身乏術.definition: to be up to one's ears in work (idiom); to be unable to attend to other things at the same time

分辨.definition: to distinguish; to differentiate; to resolve

分辯.definition: to explain the facts; to defend against an accusation

分道揚鑣.definition: lit. to take different roads and urge the horses on (idiom); fig. to part ways

分配.definition: to distribute; to assign; to allocate; to partition (a hard drive)

分配器.definition: dispenser (for consumables such as liquid soap); splitter (for cable TV signal etc)

分野.definition: dividing line between distinct realms; boundary; field-allocation (in Chinese astrology, the association between celestial regions and corresponding terrestrial realms)

分量.definition: quantity; weight; measure; (fig.) weight (importance, prestige, authority etc); (of written material) density

分針.definition: minute hand (of a clock or watch)

分鍋.definition: (dialect) to set up separate households; (sports etc) to analyze the reasons for a defeat

分門別類.definition: (idiom) to organize by categories; to classify

分音符.definition: dieresis; umlaut; diacritical mark separating two adjacent syllables

分頁.definition: (computing) to insert a page break; to paginate; pagination; memory paging; tab (GUI element)

分頻.definition: frequency sharing; subdivision of radio waveband

分餐.definition: to eat individual meals (rather than taking one's food from plates served to everyone at the table)
